acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3 from its 72h-EC50 = 45 mg/L for algae (Scenedesmus subspicatus) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on LD50 values of >200 mg/kg (SIDS (J) (access on Aug. 2009)) and 500 mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)) for rats, the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: No data available. As relevant information, no mortality was observed in an 8-hour inhalation test (animal species unknown) with saturated vapour (estimated concentration: 8.6 mg/L) at 25 degC (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of 280 mg/kg for rats (JECFA No.40 (1998), PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 3.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since its acute toxicity is Category 3 and there are no data on rapid degradation.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since flash point 56 degC (closed-cup) (HSDB (2008)) is >=23 degC and <=60 degC. The substance is classified into Class 3, PG III in UNRTDG (UN2529).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there are reports of a weak positive (without metabolic activation) and a negative (with metabolic activation) mouse lymphoma gene mutation tests (JECFA 40 (1998)), a negative rat liver UDS test (JECFA 40 (1998)), and a negative bacteria reverse mutation test (IUCLID (2000)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 420 degC (Ullmanns (E) (6th, 2003)) exceeding 70 degC.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: No data available. Although there is a report of not sensitizer in HSDB (2008), the details are not clear.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on reports of "severe cornea burning" (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and "moderately severe primary irritant" (HSDB (2008)) in a rabbit eye irritation test, and classification as corrosive for the skin, the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on a result of "caused some necrosis within 24-hour" in skin irritation test (open) with rabbits (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and a report of corrosive in rabbit test (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No data available. Although there is a report of not sensitizer in HSDB (2008), the details are not clear.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although there is a report that exposure can cause irritation of the upper respiratory tract and repeated inhalation exposure would likely exacerbate the irritative effects (SIDS (J) (access on Aug. 2009)), classification was not possible since the detailed data were unclear.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on a report that airborne isobutyric acid can cause irritation of the upper respiratory tract and repeated inhalation exposure would likely exacerbate the irritative effects (SIDS (J) (access on Aug. 2009)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation).
